intro: Paraprasophyllum albovirens, commonly known as the white-green paraprasophyllum, is a rare and specialized plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cold, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
